import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.b607cf12:
df1 = data['Competition Name'].value_counts().reset_index()

plt.figure(figsize=(15,6))
sns.barplot(x="index", y="Competition Name", data=df1)
plt.title(" Number Of Teams Belonging To Each League")
plt.xlabel("Competition Name")
plt.ylabel("Number of Competition")
plt.xticks(rotation=80)
plt.show()

plt.title("Relation between Club Name and Mean Market Value Of Club In Millions(£)")

source.a93d566b:
# Conclusion

 - According to the data **Premier League** is the most held competetion when compare from others.

 - According to the data **Manchester City** and **Paris Saint-Germain** has most market value of clube in Million
 
 - According to the data the average age of all the players in the Club is arround 25-30yrs
 
 - According to the data **Premier Leageue** has the most market values of player in almost all the the **Squard Size** but **league 1** in square size of 36 could give a neck to neck competion to Premier League.
 
- According to the data the **average size** of the squad in all the the club is arround 25-30 and Paris **Saint-Germain** has the maximum number of Squad size which is 35.
